pageContext.claim: “And after tax cuts, unemployment dropped to the lowest rate in more than 50 years.”
pageContext.analysis: The unemployment rate dropped to 3.7 percent in November of 2018 -- nearly a year after the tax cut passed. That was the lowest unemployment rate in 49 years, but it peaked up to 4 percent in January 2019 and has held steady at 3.8 percent since then.
